Thursday, January 30, 2020

Interim advice for preparedness and response to cases of the novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection at points of entry in the European Union (EU)/EEA Member States (MS) Link: /pagnet/?q=content/interim-advice-preparedness-and-response-cases-novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-infection-points

Advice for preparedness and response to cases of the novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection at points of entry in the EU/EEA Member States as well as advice for aircraft operators and ship operators have been developed under the framework of the EU HEALTHY GATEWAYS Joint Action and have been published on the EU HEALTHY GATEWAYS website at the following link: https://www.healthygateways.eu/Novel-coronavirus Link: https://www.healthygateways.eu/Novel-coronavirus

  • Read moreabout Interim advice for preparedness and response to cases of the novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection at points of entry in the European Union (EU)/EEA Member States (MS) Link: /pagnet/?q=content/interim-advice-preparedness-and-response-cases-novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-infection-points

Publication date: 

Saturday, January 25, 2020

Updated WHO advice for international traffic in relation to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus 2019-nCoV Link: /pagnet/?q=content/updated-who-advice-international-traffic-relation-outbreak-novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov

WHO advice in relation to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus nCoV was updated on 24 Jan,2020. With the information currently available for the novel coronavirus, WHO advises that measures to limit the risk of exportation or importation of the disease should be implemented, without unnecessary restrictions of international traffic.Read more on https://www.who.int/ith/2020-24-01-outbreak-of-Pneumonia-caused-by-new-coronavirus/en/.

  • Read moreabout Updated WHO advice for international traffic in relation to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus 2019-nCoV Link: /pagnet/?q=content/updated-who-advice-international-traffic-relation-outbreak-novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov

Publication type: 

News

Publication date: 

Thursday, January 23, 2020

Statement on the meeting of the International Health Regulations (2005) Emergency Committee regarding the outbreak of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Link: /pagnet/?q=content/statement-meeting-international-health-regulations-2005-emergency-committee-regarding

The meeting of the Emergency Committee convened by the WHO Director-General under the International Health Regulations (IHR) (2005) regarding the outbreak of novel coronavirus 2019 in the People’s Republic of China, with exportations currently reported in the Republic of Korea, Japan, Thailand and Singapore, took place on Wednesday, 22 January 2020, from 12:00 to 16:30 Geneva time (CEST) and on Thursday, 23 January 2020, from 12:00 to 15:10.

  • Read moreabout Statement on the meeting of the International Health Regulations (2005) Emergency Committee regarding the outbreak of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Link: /pagnet/?q=content/statement-meeting-international-health-regulations-2005-emergency-committee-regarding

Wednesday, September 25, 2019

13 countries in the European Region better equipped to assess their public health capacities at airports and ports Link: /pagnet/?q=content/13-countries-european-region-better-equipped-assess-their-public-health-capacities-airports

The World Customs Organization web-article about EVD outbreak Link: /pagnet/?q=content/world-customs-organization-web-article-about-evd-outbreak

The World Customs Organization (WCO) has published a web-article on WCO website, the article states that the WCO will keep a close watch on the EVD outbreak and the associated travel- and trade-related developments in this regard. The WCO Secretary General, Dr. Kunio Mikuriya, recently wrote to WHO Director General, Dr.

News

Publication date: 

Saturday, July 20, 2019

WHO recommendations for international traffic related to the Ebola Virus Disease outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo Link: /pagnet/?q=content/who-recommendations-international-traffic-related-ebola-virus-disease-outbreak-democratic

On 17 July, the Director-General of the World Health Organization declared the current Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo a Public Health Emergency of International Concern under the International Health Regulations (IHR). In view of this declaration, WHO has published recommendations regarding international traffic on 19 Jul, including general recommendations, exit screening at international airports of affected country,entry screening/cross-border screening.

  • Read moreabout WHO recommendations for international traffic related to the Ebola Virus Disease outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo Link: /pagnet/?q=content/who-recommendations-international-traffic-related-ebola-virus-disease-outbreak-democratic

Thursday, July 11, 2019

IHR Assessment Mission for Points of Entry in Nigeria Link: /pagnet/?q=content/ihr-assessment-mission-points-entry-nigeria

From 24-28 June, Nigeria welcomed a WHO-led team to assess and support national International Health Regulations (IHR) capacities at Points of Entry (PoE) across the nation Read more here: https://extranet.who.int/sph/news/ihr-assessment-mission-points-entry-nigeria Link: https://extranet.who.int/sph/news/ihr-assessment-mission-points-entry-nigeria
